title: Carmen Barth
text:
Carmine R. DiBartholomeo, better known as Carmen Barth (September 13, 1912 – September 17, 1985), was a male <a href="United%20States">American</a> <a href="Boxing">boxer</a> who competed in the <a href="1932%20Summer%20Olympics">1932 Summer Olympics</a>. He was born and raised in the <a href="Collinwood">Collinwood</a> neighborhood of <a href="Cleveland%2C%20Ohio">Cleveland, Ohio</a> and died in <a href="Lorain%2C%20Ohio">Lorain, Ohio</a>.
Amateur career.
In 1931 Barth won 160 Lb Amateur Title of Cleveland. In 1932 he won the gold medal in the middleweight class after winning the final against <a href="Amado%20Azar">Amado Azar</a>.
